newsitem.title: UK: BFI up three as S.Atlantic demand builds.
newsitem.headline: BFI up three as S.Atlantic demand builds.

text.p: The Baltic Freight Index was up three points on Thursday at 1,272 points and the Baltic Handy Index was down one to 1,085 points.
Brokers said that despite a continuing dull Caper market demand for Panamaxes has increased worldwide with improved rates reported in the North Pacific and South Atlantic in particular.

Pressure has built up rapdidly for Panaamxes and Handy-sizes from Argentina and Brazil with Despina 65,644 dwt fixed by South Korean charterers delivery spot Recalada for a trip via the Plate to the Far East at a remarkably firm rate close to $13,500 daily plus $350,000 bonus.
Despite the minor fall in the Handy Index brokers reported firming conditions in most areas for geared tonnage.
At 1300 GMT BIFFEX was unchanged to 15 points lower and turnover totalled 52 lots.
